intro: Sedum rosea var. roanense, commonly known as the Roan Mountain stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to the Appalachian Mountains. It features thick, fleshy leaves that are typically blue-green in color, arranged in a rosette pattern. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a hardy species suitable for rock gardens. Its low-growing habit and drought tolerance make it an attractive and easy-to-care-for ornamental plant.
